docs.snippet: Difficulties in remitting earnings to its American headquarters and in importing raw materials soon may halt or force revision of expansion in the vast foreign manufacturing activities of the General Electric Company. Last week William R. Herod,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Difficulties in remitting earnings to its American headquarters and in importing raw materials soon may halt or force revision of expansion in the vast foreign manufacturing activities of the General Electric Company. Last week William R. Herod, president of International General Electric Company, hinted strongly that his organization is far from satisfied with treatment by foreign governments.
docs.abstract: Pres Herod repts difficulties in remitting earnings to Amer hdqrs and in importing raw materials may halt or force revision of foreign mfg expansion; says output, on completion of expansion, will be 10 times '38

docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 6 -- Chile's First World Congress of Journalists closed today with a formal session in Valparaiso after four days of meetings here in which both Communist and peronista elements failed conspicuously in efforts to get support for their ideas.

headline.main: LATIN PRESS RALLY BALKS EXTREMISTS; Red and Peronista Groups Fail to Win Support -- Tribunals on News Accuracy Rejected

byline.original: By SAM POPE BREWERSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: British sterling moved irregularly last week. It hardened at the outset on the improved gold and dollar surplus in November of $128,000,000, which lifted the pound to $2.80 11/16, highest since mid-May. Later, on the Churchill plan that Britain had...
docs.lead_paragraph: British sterling moved irregularly last week. It hardened at the outset on the improved gold and dollar surplus in November of $128,000,000, which lifted the pound to $2.80 11/16, highest since mid-May. Later, on the Churchill plan that Britain had decided to limit its defense program because of financial difficulties the pound turned to the offering side and drifted slowly to a close on Friday of $2.80 1/4.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 8 -- The United States gave its support today to a Latin-American compromise resolution on the Tunisian question asking that negotiations be continued "on an urgent basis with a view to bringing about self-government for...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 8 -- The United States gave its support today to a Latin-American compromise resolution on the Tunisian question asking that negotiations be continued "on an urgent basis with a view to bringing about self-government for Tunisians in the light of the relevant provisions of the Charter of the United Nations."

docs.snippet: Mario Pei, associate professor of Romance Philology at Columbia University and author of "The Story of English" and "The Story of Language," will have his first novel published in March by John Day. Mr. Pei, an authority on the Middle Ages, has based...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mario Pei, associate professor of Romance Philology at Columbia University and author of "The Story of English" and "The Story of Language," will have his first novel published in March by John Day. Mr. Pei, an authority on the Middle Ages, has based his story on the Song of Roland.

docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 8 -- After thirteen delegations had voiced objections to a Uruguayan proposal for reaffirming the right of each state to nationalize and exploit freely its national resources, the Uruguayan delegation won an adjournment today.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 9 -- Uruguay and Bolivia submitted today to the General Assembly's Economic and Financial Committee a revised draft proposal, reaffirming the right of nationalization of natural resources. They said the new draft had the...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 9 -- Uruguay and Bolivia submitted today to the General Assembly's Economic and Financial Committee a revised draft proposal, reaffirming the right of nationalization of natural resources. They said the new draft had the support of eight other delegations.
docs.abstract: Uruguay and Bolivia submit revised draft; Cusano, others on nationalization
